Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
June 13, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective action
plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed or
implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4111 Job description
• (1) An institution shall provide a job description for
each staff position that identifies rules, required
qualifications, and lines of authority.
One of one employee file that has been employed more than one year did not
have a job description.
CCI Rule 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers
• (1) The licensee shall document, prior to
employment, that each employee and volunteer
2

who has contact with residents 4 or more hours
per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is
free from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom
from communicable tuberculosis shall be verified
within the 1 year period before employment and
shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current
verification.
One of one employee file that has been employed for more than one year did not
have yearly verification of being free from communicable tuberculosis.
CCI Rule 400.4120 Supervisor of direct care workers; qualifications.
• (1) A supervisor of direct care workers must have
1 of the following:
• (a) A bachelor's degree from an accredited
college or university and 2 years of work
experience in a child caring institution.
One of one employee file who has been employed for more than one year was
promoted to a supervisor position without having two years of experience in a child
caring institution.
CCI Rule 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical examinations.
• (1) An initial health screening shall be completed
for each resident within 24 hours of admission to
a facility.
One of three youth files reviewed did not have an initial health screening
completed within 24 hours of admission. The youth was admitted on 01/05/24 and
the initial health screen was completed on 01/08/2024.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
• (1) The social service worker shall complete,
sign, and date an updated treatment plan for each
resident at least once every 90-calendar days
following the initial treatment plan.
3

One of three youth files reviewed did not have an updated treatment plan
completed within 90 days. The treatment plan was two days late.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
During this period under review the Gerber House was damaged due to a fire. The
agency is removing the Gerber House from this license and decreasing the total
capacity from 20 to 10. They are also changing the name on the license from Eagle
Village Gerber-Putnam to Eagle Village Putnam.
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted five acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
2023 Renewal: Corrective Action Plan was recorded during this reporting period as
a result of the Renewal inspection completed on April 13, 2023. This CAP
contained violations for a performance evaluations not being completed on time,
initial documentation not being completed and initial service plan being late. The
facility set up calendar reminders and Human Resources provided leadership a
weekly listing of upcoming evaluations due, a file review form was created and
utilized for new youth entering care, and the clinical services manager sent out due
dates to therapistj/case manager listing due dates for reports. The facility is
currently complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor
CAP compliance with no noted concerns.
Special Investigation 2023C0000416 with CAP approval date of 06/05/2023 was a
result of the facility not following their internal policy of supervision of a youth. The
facility reviewed their supervision policy during academy. The facility is currently
complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor CAP
compliance with no noted concerns.
4

Special Investigation 2023C0000554 with CAP approval date of 07/24/2023 was a
result of the medication cart not being locked. The facility reviewed the policy
during academy and leadership completes a walkthrough of the facility two times
per month to ensure the medication cart is locked. The facility is currently
complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor CAP
compliance with no noted concerns.
Special Investigation 2023C0000734 with CAP approval date 10/11/2023 was a
result of vehicle keys not being secure and a youth gaining access to the keys.
The facility updated their policy and trained staff on the new policy. The facility is
currently complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor
CAP compliance with no noted concerns.
Special Investigation 2023C0000795 with CAP approval date 11/20/2023 was a
result of variable interval night checks exceeding 15 minutes and falsifaction of
documentation. Leadership is reviewing third shift video to ensure variable interval
night checks not exceeding 15 minutes are occurring and documentation of the
checks match what is seen on video. The facility is currently complying with the
CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor CAP compliance with no noted
concerns.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. Chief Administrator reported
since the last reporting period the facility has utilized their CAPs and worked to stay
in compliance. There has been staffing turnover and there is a new supervisor at
the house. The facility worked with Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) to help reduce
restraints numbers.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff have reported there has been a lot of staff turnover which can be difficult on
the remaining staff as well as the youth. Staff stated they feel supported by
leadership and have weekly training. Staff reported discussing restraints regularly
and talking about things staff can do differently in situations to help de-escalate
youth.
5

Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection. Youth reported liking it at
the facility because of all the activities, feeling like staff care about them and having
regular therapy and programing. One youth indicated he would like to be able to
ride dirt bikes at the facility because there is so much space. All of the youth
interviewed reported feeling safe at the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on June 3, 2024.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
